VIII.ii.1.D.2.b
.
Developing Claims for Infectious Diseases
In addition to the usual evidence-gathering procedures for claims, follow the procedures below when processing a claim for SC of an infectious disease under
38 CFR 3.317
.
Step
Action
1
Does the Veteran have qualifying service as defined in
38 CFR 3.317(c)(3)(ii)
and as detailed in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, 1.D.1.a
?
If
yes
, go to next step.
If
no
, send the claim for a decision.
2
Is there credible lay or medical evidence of a qualifying infectious disease within the time limit, if applicable, specified in
38 CFR 3.317(c)(3)(i)
?
If
yes
, go to the next step.
If
no
, send the claim for a decision.
3
Is the Veteran claiming one of the long-term health effects listed in
38 CFR 3.317(d)(2)
due to the infectious disease?
If
yes
, go to the next step.
If
no
, go to Step 5.
4
Is there credible lay or medical evidence of the long-term health effect, and if applicable, within the time limit specified in
38 CFR 3.317(d)(2)
?
If
yes
,
request a medical opinion as outlined in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, 1.D.2.c
, and
go to the next step.
If
no
, go to the next step.
5
Request an examination for the infectious disease, if needed to decide the claim, following the guidance in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, 1.D.2.c
.

:Â  For more information on infectious diseases under
38 CFR 3.317
and potential long-term health effects, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, 1.D.1.d
.
